title: Jerusalem the Golden

author.name: Bernard of Cluny
author.bio: Bernard of Cluny, also known as Bernard of Morlaix, was a Benedictine monk of the 12th century, best known for his Latin poem 'De Contemptu Mundi,' from which 'Jerusalem the Golden' is derived.

lyrics:
Jerusalem the golden,
With milk and honey blest,
Beneath Thy contemplation
Sink heart and voice opprest,
I know not, O I know not,
What holy joys are there,
What radiancy of glory,
What bliss beyond compare!

They stand, those halls of Zion,
All jubilant with song,
And bright with many an Angel
And all the martyr-throng;
There is the throne of David;
And there, from toil released,
The shout of them that triumph
The song of them that feast.

And they who with their leader,
Have conquered in the fight
For ever and for ever,
Are clad in robes of white;
O land that see'st no sorrow
O state that fear'st no strife.
O royal land of flowers!
O realm and home of life!

O sweet and blessed country
The home of God's elect,
O sweet and blessed country
That eager hearts expect
Jesus, in mercy bring us
To that dear land of rest,
Who art, with God the Father,
And Spirit, ever blest!
